title: Container
description: This schema defines the Container entity. A Container is an abstraction for any path(including the top level eg. bucket in S3) storing data in an Object store such as S3, GCP, Azure. It maps a tree-like structure, where each Container can have a parent and a list of sub-folders, and it can be structured - where it contains structured data, or unstructured where no schema for its data is defined.

containerDataModel.description: This captures information about how the container's data is modeled, if it has a schema.

isPartitioned.description: Whether the data under this container is partitioned by some property, eg. eventTime=yyyy-mm-dd

columns.description: Columns belonging to this container's schema

fileFormat.description: This schema defines the file formats for the object/files within a container.

dataFormat.description: This schema defines the file formats for the object/files within a container.

id.description: Unique identifier that identifies this container instance.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Name that uniquely identifies a container in the format 'ServiceName.ContainerName'.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this container.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to this entity.

objectStoreService.description: Link to the object store service where this container is hosted in.

serviceType.description: Service type where this container is hosted in.

parent.description: Link to the parent container under which this entity sits.

children.description: References to child containers residing under this entity.

dataModel.description: References to the container's data model, if data is structured, or null otherwise

prefix.description: Optional prefix path defined for this container

numberOfObjects.description: The number of objects/files this container has.

size.description: The total size in KB this container has.

fileFormats.description: This can have items of fileFormat or dataFormat. e.g. fileFormats=[csv, mp4]  dataModel=null as it's not structured, fileFormats=[parquet] and have dataModel informed as all parquets follow the same schema, fileFormats=[parquet] and have a non informed dataModel because the parquets have different schemas

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.
